name: Mandazi
description: Mandazi are delicious East African doughnuts that are perfect for breakfast or a snack.
instructions: Mix Dry Ingredients: In a large bowl, combine the flour, yeast, sugar, and salt.
Add Wet Ingredients: Gradually add the warm milk, warm water, and melted butter to the dry ingredients. Mix until a soft dough forms.
Knead the Dough: Knead the dough on a lightly floured surface for about 10 minutes, or until smooth and elastic.
Rest the Dough: Cover the dough with a clean cloth and let it rise in a warm place for about 1 hour, or until doubled in size.
Shape the Mandazi: Punch down the dough and roll it out to about 1 cm thickness. Cut the dough into desired shapes, such as squares or triangles.
Fry the Mandazi: Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or large pot to about 170°C (340°F). Carefully fry the mandazi, a few at a time, until golden brown on both sides.
Drain and Serve: Remove the fried mandazi from the oil and drain on paper towels. Serve warm with tea, coffee, or your favorite dipping sauce.
